    • xFromPixel

      double xFromPixel(double px)
      converts a pixel amount to the corresponding mathematical x value (based on the function, scale, offset)
      Parameters:
      px - the pixel value of x in the graph
      Returns:
      the corresponding mathematical value of x at the specific spot on the canvas

    • yFromPixel

      double yFromPixel(double py)
      converts a pixel amount to the corresponding mathematical y value (based on the function, scale, offset)
      Parameters:
      py - the pixel value of y in the graph
      Returns:
      the corresponding mathematical value of y at the specific spot on the canvas

    • xToPixel

      double xToPixel(double x)
      converts a mathematical x value to its corresponding value on the graph (in pixels, distance from left canvas)
      Parameters:
      x - the mathematical value of x
      Returns:
      the pixel value of where the x should be

    • yToPixel

      double yToPixel(double y)
      converts a mathematical y value to its corresponding value on the graph (in pixels, distance from top of canvas)
      Parameters:
      y - the mathematical value of y
      Returns:
      the pixel value of where the y should be

    • redraw

      public void redraw()
      resets the graph and updates it based on changes in offset, scale, etc.

    • isNearFunction

      private boolean isNearFunction(Function function)
      checks if the mouse is within range of a function to display the current hovered point
      Parameters:
      function - the function to check
      Returns:
      true or false: the mouse is within range

    • computeTickStep

      private double computeTickStep(double scale)
      finds the ideal tick step based on the scale that is easy to navigate/understand
      Parameters:
      scale - the current scale of the graph
      Returns:
      the tick step (math distance between ticks) that the graph should follow

    • getBase

      private double getBase(double scale)
      gets the amount of squares that should be between two ticks on a graph based on the scale
      Parameters:
      scale - the current scale of the graph
      Returns:
      the number of squares that should be between two ticks

    • getExp

      private int getExp(double scale)
      gets the degree of a value (10^x) / amount of zeros
      Parameters:
      scale - the current scale of the graph
      Returns:
      the degree of the value

      public void drawLines(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)

      Parameters:

    • drawLinesX

      private void drawLinesX(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, double step)
      draws all vertical lines of the graph to replicate graph paper
      Parameters:
      gc - the corresponding graphics context
      step - the distance between each line

    • drawLinesY

      private void drawLinesY(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, double step)
      draws all horizontal lines of the graph to replicate graph paper
      Parameters:
      gc - the corresponding graphics context
      step - the distance between each line

    • drawFunction

      public void drawFunction(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, Function f, javafx.scene.paint.Color color, double opacity)
      Draws a function in a corresponding canvas
      Parameters:
      gc - the graphics context of the canvas in which the function will be contained
      f - the function when drawing
      color - the color of the curve
      opacity - the opacity of the curve (1 for regular functions, 0.5 for derivatives)

    • drawIntercepts

      private void drawIntercepts(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Draws intercepts of the two functions (firstFunction, secondFunction)
      Parameters:
      gc - The graphics context of the canvas in which intercepts should be contained
